item.title: Ghost of Yotei Reveals Gorgeous Limited-Time PS5 Console Bundles
item.description:
Ghost of Yotei is getting two remarkable limited-time PS5 bundles that fans of the series will want to see. The Ghost of Yotei PS5s include a number of references to the game, the culture it originates from, and there's also something available for fans who already own a PlayStation 5 and just want to customize it.

Ghost of Tsushima 's successor is one step closer to its release following a State of Play featuring Ghost of Yotei . Fans still have awhile to wait, as Ghost of Yotei will launch in October, but the new reveals in the State of Play, as well as this new limited edition bundle, are likely to stir excitement even more.

PlayStation has now announced two Ghost of Yotei PS5 variants, as well as covers that can be used on the PlayStation 5 Slim and the PlayStation 5 Pro, and DualSense controllers. The consoles feature an ink-style painting of Mt. Yotei, an iconic mountain in Hokkaido, as the game is set in a fictional, historical version of the area. The consoles and DualSense controllers also feature a "special maker's seal" engraved with PlayStation shapes. The gold version of the console will be available at select retailers and direct from PlayStation, while the black version is exclusive to PlayStation's store.

Ghost of Yotei Gets Two PS5 Variants

While the two consoles feature what's essentially the same image, there are some stark differences between them. The Ghost of Yotei Gold Limited Edition Bundle is inspired by kintsugi, a traditional art form in Japan that repairs broken objects with carefully applied gold. It comes with a matching DualSense controller, and a digital copy of the Standard Edition of the game with pre-order content. The Ghost of Yotei Black Limited Edition Bundle is designed based upon the Japanese artstyle of Sumi-e, which is a form of black ink painting. In addition to the image of the mountain on the consoles, the controllers feature an image of Atsu standing in profile with her sword drawn.

For gamers who already own PS5s, two Ghost of Yotei Gold Limited Edition console covers are being sold for both the PlayStation 5 Pro and the PlayStation 5 Slim. Both the black and gold variants of the DualSense controller will be available for purchase separately, as well. The full bundles, covers, and controllers will launch on October 2, with pre-orders opening at some point prior to that. Supplies will be limited, so interested fans will want to keep an eye open for the pre-order window.

item.title: The Sims 4: How to Avoid Death by Emotional Overload (Fairy Sims)
item.description:
In The Sims 4 , gamers who play with fairy Sims will have to keep their Emotional Force Needs in check. Otherwise, they will die of Emotional Starvation. However, it is possible for them to also die of Emotional Overload if players aren't careful.

This guide will tell players about the dangers that come when fairy Sims consume emotions that are too powerful in The Sims 4 Enchanted by Nature. Thankfully, if gamers take the right precautions, they can easily avoid this death.

How to Avoid Emotional Overload in The Sims 4

Fairy Sims need to replenish their Emotional Force in order to avoid Emotional Starvation in The Sims 4 . There are various way to regenerate the Emotional Force Needs meter, but the most practical one is to absorb the emotion of other Sims. However, if Sims absorb too many powerful emotions, their fairy Sim will suffer an overload and die as a consequence. Therefore, before absorbing a Sim's emotions, gamers should consider detecting nearby emotions first .

In these scenarios, it's better to be safe than sorry, and if gamers want to ensure the safety of their fairy Sims, they should verify if they plan on absorbing the emotions of someone who is relatively mindful. To check if a Sim doesn't have overly powerful emotions that shouldn't be absorbed, the player must select their Sim (or another Sim) near an area with other Sims, enter the Fairy menu, and select Detect Emotions .

When detecting emotions, a smiley will appear next to eligible Sims, expressing their current mood. If the emotions are too powerful, a Danger sign will appear next to the smiley face.

The Stages of Emotional Overload in The Sims 4

If players absorb powerful emotions five times within a short period of time, they will die of Emotional Overload. Here are the moodlets that they will receive before this happens:

  • Impeding Overload (Tense +2)
  • Minor Hysterical Overload (Playful +3)
  • Major Hysterical Overload (Playful +8)
  • Critical Hysterical Overload (Playful +15)
  • Death by Laughter (caused by Emotional Overload)

The final stages of hysterical overload last 12 hours, so if gamers want to avoid an Emotional Overload death in The Sims 4 , they need to make sure that they don't absorb emotions that are too powerful during the hours that the moodlet is live .

item.title: After Burning So Brightly, It May Be Time for Borderlands 4 to Cool Its Jets
item.description:
There has been no shortage of Borderlands 4 content in the last few weeks, as tons of details about the game have been revealed through trailers, gameplay snippets, and creator hands-on previews. With so much out there to discover, it's an exciting time for fans of the franchise, but if Gearbox isn't careful, all that information might become a problem. With the best interests of both players and Borderlands 4 itself in mind, it might be time for the studio to cool its jets and consider how to sustain the hype.

Ever since Borderlands 4 's dedicated State of Play, 2K and Gearbox Software have been releasing a steady stream of information about the upcoming title. Before any publications or creators even got their hands on a preview, the studio pulled back the curtain on huge chunks of content. This included cinematic trailers, raw gameplay footage showcasing story missions, and a deep dive into the weapon customization system. Through a pre-order trailer, players have even seen a full (albeit blurry) image of the new open-world map. And while these new reveals and deep dives are undeniably exciting for fans of the series, as the release of Borderlands 4 approaches, it's worth asking whether all this exposure will end up helping or hurting the upcoming release.

Borderlands 4 Shouldn't Risk Any More Overexposure

Within the hype-cycle of every unreleased game, there is the terrible potential for information over-saturation, which will effectively stop all player excitement in its tracks. The once-exciting content becomes repetitive and uninteresting as players are stripped of any anticipation by the feeling of having seen most of what is on offer. Likely to be one of the biggest releases of Fall 2025, Borderlands 4 could push Borderlands beyond 100 million units sold, and if Gearbox intends to keep fans hyped for release, it should consider taking a step back. Hype should be moderated, and the information that is currently out there is more than enough for now. Especially when overexposure risks more than the hype of a game, as it could substantially affect the enjoyment of the final product.

As a core mechanic and pillar of the franchise, how Gearbox could improve vault hunting in Borderlands 4 was always relevant to players, even before the announcement of the game. The State of Play revealed that there were multiple vaults to open and explore in the game, and that it was actually a standalone system not inherently tied to story progression. This information was enough to generate interesting conversations about the system, the potential rewards, and how players might best approach vault hunting.

Subsequent Borderlands 4 gameplay footage was revealed, this time showing the experience of going through a vault, essentially revealing everything about the system; the vaults function like mini-dungeons with a few combat arenas, and a boss fight and character ability upgrade at the end. Unless there are completely unique encounters and quest structures, this extra gameplay could cause some players to feel that one of the game’s biggest features may already feel too familiar.

Borderlands 4 Marketing Shouldn't Undercut the Series’ Biggest Strengths

One of the Borderlands franchise's best qualities is its ability to subvert a player's expectations. It's why the emotional depth of a Borderlands 2 character like Tiny Tina was so evocative, and why the mad dash to loot General Knox's armory before it explodes with the player in it in the original Borderlands is so memorable. That's also why it would be a particularly big mistake to reveal much more of Borderlands 4 's seemingly darker tone and story. A substantial narrative pivot from the previous game, the announcement that Borderlands 4 would pare down some of the humor of the franchise was a turn many players weren't expecting. To capitalize on that narrative shift and maximize its impact, Gearbox shouldn't risk losing the element of surprise.

Despite Borderlands 4 being the first in the franchise to have an open-world map, exploration has always been a strength of the series. The feeling of discovery went beyond just finding new or sometimes hidden areas. It was equally felt when players were discovering unique weapons, and figuring out build compositions that radically alter any given playstyle. Considering its open world, portable vehicle spawning, and open world activities, Borderlands 4 could have the franchise's best exploration. How much the marketing reveals and how much there is to explore when the game finally releases is inversely related, and Gearbox should be aware of that for whatever it reveals next. Revealing too much too early could completely undercut any of that sense of discovery.

None of this is to say that most of the information already out there is a bad thing. If anything, it's completely in line with the spirit of the franchise; Borderlands is a success in part because it celebrates chaos, excess, and gleefully rejects subtlety or moderation. It's fitting this lack of moderation fits Gearbox's "more is more" marketing philosophy, and, in general, it's a good sign for fans. The decision to reveal so much speaks to Gearbox Software's confidence in the game and its overall health. And so far, that confidence seems to be well-earned, as the gameplay footage has generally been met with positive responses online, and Borderlands 4 hands-on previews have received high praise, as well.

Gearbox Software's confidence in the game is great, but oversharing isn't half as powerful as restraint. With a few months still to go before release on September 12, it might be prudent for the studio to slow down with the reveals. It isn't because the game doesn’t look promising, but because the secrets that might be hidden in Borderlands 4 could be what make it all the more impactful when players finally get their hands on it.

item.title: Sea of Thieves Adding Big New Feature in 2026
item.description:
Sea of Thieves has revealed that it will add paid custom servers in 2026. Sea of Thieves is a multiplayer game that allows players to explore the seas with friends. However, as it is a PvP game, Sea of Thieves players can also encounter opponents on their adventures.

Rare launched Season 16 on May 22, the first since Sea of Thieves arrived on Battle.net. This season introduced new cosmetics and in-game currency for players to unlock as they level up the new Plunder Pass. Another notable addition is the Reaper's Bones Crew voyage "Search for Ancient Secrets," which brings together crews and the Order of Bone and Blade Skeletons to unearth an ancient sarcophagus. Sea of Thieves continues to get support through regular updates, and in the coming months, players can expect the addition of a highly anticipated feature.

Related
I think Sea of Thieves has quietly become one of the best multiplayer games out there

Sea of Thieves is probably one of the quieter games out there. You don't hear about it often, but often enough to know that it's a pretty large game with a vast player base. And it's really cool to see where it started from; what used to be a very bare-bones pirate game reached far into being an expanding world of enthralling lore and chaotic multiplayer combat. Its balance of role-play, discovery, and socializing makes it not only enjoyable but characteristically memorable in a way few multiplayer games achieve.

Sea of Thieves has revealed that it will add paid custom servers in 2026. Named Custom Seas, the announcement was made during the Sea of Thieves Community Direct, the first in the game's history. The developers explained that on these servers, players will be able to use switches, toggles, and commands to create a personalized experience. Some possibilities include using commands to spawn items and enemies, disabling storms, enemies' AI, and even the Kraken. On paid custom servers, players will be able to run Sea of Thieves ' Safer Seas mode, earning rewards alongside their friends. There is still no exact date for the addition of the custom paid servers or how much they will cost.

Sea of Thieves Announces Paid Custom Servers and Outlines Changes to Seasonal Updates

Despite the wave of layoffs announced by Microsoft in early July, the Sea of Thieves developers revealed that they remain focused on improving core gameplay, stability, and introducing new experiences. As a result, Sea of Thieves seasons will change, and instead of delivering content at the beginning of the month, it will be added in stages. With this, the plan is to keep the community engaged throughout all stages of a season. Rare also teased the expansion of Devil's Roar, a region characterized by its volcanic environment, for Season 18.

In addition to confirming the arrival of custom servers and mentioning future seasons of the game, Rare lifted the NDA on the Insider Program to “inspire more conversation” about Sea of Thieves . With this, the studio shows that despite the wave of uncertainty left by Microsoft's layoffs, there is active work to keep Sea of Thieves an entertaining multiplayer game.

item.title: How to Regenerate Emotional Force in The Sims 4 (Fairy Sims)
item.description:
Fairies can consume food in The Sims 4 Enchanted by Nature, and while it may give them positive or negative moodlets, it doesn't affect their Needs, as they don't have a Hunger meter like human Sims and other occult species. Instead, players have to keep an eye on their Emotional Force Need.

This guide tells players what they need to know about the Emotional Force Need in The Sims 4 , and it teaches players how they can take care of it to ensure that their fairy Sims don't accidentally die of Emotional Starvation.

How to Fill Emotional Force Need in The Sims 4

How to Feed a Fairy in The Sims 4

There are four ways to regain Emotional Force in The Sims 4 ; players can either regenerate it at a Fairy Home, using Fairy Dust, taking advantage of certain Fairy Abilities, or absorbing the emotion of another Sim.

How to Regenerate Emotional Force at a Fairy Home

There are several Fairy Homes scattered around Innisgreen, and players can also place them in their owned lots. They fill up with Emotional Force from time to time, and fairy Sims can interact with them and absorb it .

However, this option can often be unavailable, as Sims can only absorb emotions from Fairy Homes once before they need to replenish. This forces players to find other methods of increasing their Emotional Force Need while they wait.

How to Use Fairy Dust to Regenerate Emotional Force

Players can regenerate Emotional Force by using five piles of Fairy Dust from their inventory . To replenish Emotional Force with Fairy Dust, gamers must select their starved Sim, open the Fairy menu, and select Regenerate Emotional Force with Fairy Dust.

Unlock Emotional Force Regeneration Abilities

As fairy Sims increase their rank, they receive Ability Points that can be used to unlock Fairy Abilities. In the Customization Abilities section, there are perks that make it possible for Sims to replenish their Emotional Force by performing certain interactions or gain extra Emotional Force by absorbing a certain type of emotions.

How to Absorb Emotions From Other Sims

The most reliable way to regenerate Emotional Force in The Sims 4 is to absorb the emotions of other Sims . Gamers will deplete their stock of Fairy Dust much faster if they use it for Emotional Force regeneration, so they might want to save it for other purposes. Fairy Homes also aren't a reliable way to replenish this Need, as they become depleted after being absorbed.

To absorb a Sim's emotions in The Sims 4 and replenish this Need for fairy Sims, players have to interact with a Sim while controlling a fairy Sim, select the Fairy social menu, and then pick the Absorb Emotion option . This option will be unavailable for Sims who don't have strong enough moodlets at the time, but if players are in a lot with heavy traffic, they shouldn't have problems finding a Sim with emotions to absorb.

Players should consider using the Detect Emotion interaction whenever they are in a highly populated area, as it allows them to see which Sims have emotions to absorb and which Sims have emotions that are too powerful. If a fairy absorbs too many powerful emotions, it can lead to Death by Emotional Overload.
